body:
It’s clearly not prepared for the recent influx of new users these past couple of days, and it became a very unpleasant experience to use Ruqqus since then because it’s going down all the time.

I know, there’s costs involved, but this is not the time for saving expenses, otherwise you’ll scare away all those new users that seem to be coming in large numbers.

Otherwise, it’s killing the site while it’s beginning to thrive, and it would break my heart to know Ruqqus could have been a hit, but failed because its owners were afraid.

Cheers.
body_html:
It’s clearly not prepared for the recent influx of new users these past couple of days, and it became a very unpleasant experience to use Ruqqus since then because it’s going down all the time.

I know, there’s costs involved, but this is not the time for saving expenses, otherwise you’ll scare away all those new users that seem to be coming in large numbers.

Otherwise, it’s killing the site while it’s beginning to thrive, and it would break my heart to know Ruqqus could have been a hit, but failed because its owners were afraid.

Cheers.

body: Voat's downfall was it being made too early. It was a point in time where only the worst of the worse were being forced off of Reddit. Years later we're seeing a broader, more partisan crackdown on what people are allowed to do. To that end Ruqqus may have the timing just right.
body_html: Voat's downfall was it being made too early. It was a point in time where only the worst of the worse were being forced off of Reddit. Years later we're seeing a broader, more partisan crackdown on what people are allowed to do. To that end Ruqqus may have the timing just right.

body:
"[Responsibly report a security issue to us](https://ruqqus.com/help/titles)"

For [Dog2puppy in particular](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/pull/224):  He told captainmeta4 about [this](https://mathiasbynens.github.io/rel-noopener/)

Edit: He was the first one to get it. That's why you've never seen it before.
body_html:
"Responsibly report a security issue to us"

For Dog2puppy in particular: He told captainmeta4 about this

Edit: He was the first one to get it. That's why you've never seen it before.

Otherwise, it’s killing the site while it’s beginning to thrive, and it would break my heart to know Ruqqus could have been a hit, but failed because its owners were afraid.

Cheers.

It’s clearly not prepared for the recent influx of new users these past couple of days, and it became a very unpleasant experience to use Ruqqus since then because it’s going down all the time.

I know, there’s costs involved, but this is not the time for saving expenses, otherwise you’ll scare away all those new users that seem to be coming in large numbers.

Otherwise, it’s killing the site while it’s beginning to thrive, and it would break my heart to know Ruqqus could have been a hit, but failed because its owners were afraid.
